meanings.definition: A small, four-stringed musical instrument of Hawaiian origin.
meanings.sent1: She strummed the ukulele gently by the beach.
meanings.sent2: He learned to play the ukulele at a young age.
meanings.sent3: The ukulele serenaded the palm trees with its sweet melody.
meanings.sent4: The ukulele's music danced in the air like a joyful breeze.
meanings.sent5: The bright sound of the ukulele filled the room with happiness.

meanings.sent1: He loves to ukulele during family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: She will ukulele at the talent show next week.
meanings.sent3: Don't ukulele too loudly, you might wake up the neighbors!
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the strings as she ukuleled the familiar tune.
meanings.sent5: The way he ukuleles with passion always brings a smile to my face.
